title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse leader programs eligible for support. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs that provide full-time education for registered nurses to become qualified to provide effective care through wellness. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized education programs for registered nurses to become qualified to provide effective care through wellness and illness continuum in nurse-managed health clinics. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 801 of the Public Health Service Act to define nurse-managed health clinics as arrangements managed by advanced practice nurses providing primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 801 of the Public Health Service Act to include nurse anesthetists and clinical nurse specialists in nurse-managed health clinics providing primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs. Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is amended to update various sections related to loan repayment, scholarship programs, nurse faculty loans, and comprehensive geriatric education. Funding for carrying out specific parts is also addressed. The Public Health Service Act is amended to update sections related to loan repayment, scholarship programs, nurse faculty loans, and comprehensive geriatric education. Funding for specific parts is also addressed. The Public Health Service Act is amended to update sections related to loan repayment, scholarship programs, nurse faculty loans, and comprehensive geriatric education. Additionally, amendments are made to Nurse Education, Practice, Quality, and Retention Grants. Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel through training in diverse settings and populations, and to advance individuals to become professional nurses with advanced education. The amendment to Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act promotes career advancement for nursing personnel through training in diverse settings and populations, including cross-training and specialty training for various roles such as professional nurses, advanced education nurses, licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides. The amendment to Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act aims to advance nursing personnel careers by providing training for various roles, including licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, home health aides, and others to become baccalaureate prepared registered nurses or advanced education nurses. The amendment aims to advance nursing personnel careers by providing training for various roles to become baccalaureate prepared registered nurses or advanced education nurses, and by developing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing. The amendment includes developing internships and residency programs with accredited schools of nursing to encourage mentoring and specialty development.
